patterns: I don't know what are pronouns
responses: Pronouns come in many forms. They are linguistic tools that we use to refer to people.

Sexual orientation is about who you're attracted to and who you feel drawn to romantically, emotionally, and sexually. It's different than gender identity. Gender identity isn't about who you're attracted to, but about who you are male, female, genderqueer, etc.

patterns: Having trouble about my sexually identity
responses: If your having trouble identifiying yourself, here is a test for you to take to better understand yourself: https://psycho-tests.com/test/gender-identity-test.
LGBTQ+ is an initialism that stands for lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender
A lesbian is a woman who is physically and romantically attracted to other women.
A Bisexual is a person sexually attracted not exclusively to people of one particular gender.
A person who is attracted to both men and women.
Gay is a man who is physically and romantically attracted to other men.
A transsexual is a person who has decided that they want to live as a person of the opposite sex

patterns: what can you do for me
what can you help me do
responses: My work is to help you understand your identity, I can also help you find communities/event within the country
There are currently no upcoming events

patterns: Is it wrong to be part of the LGBTQ+ Community?
responses: No, no one can stop you from voicing your opinion and be part of the LGBTQ+ Community because Sexual orientation and gender identity are integral aspects of our selves and should never lead to discrimination or abuse.

patterns: What are organization that helps the LGBT

patterns: How do I come out to my family and friends?
responses: you can tell to the person or family who you trust the mosts through phone, email or text message because it'll make you less nervous if you're having a second thought about coming out.
